visualization_prompt: Generate a column chart showing hierarchical market share distribution using drilldown interaction with synthetic browser version data
visualization_explanation:
The dataset contains hierarchical categorical data with two levels: browser brands (primary categories) and their respective versions (subcategories). Market share percentages represent continuous quantitative variables. Synthetic data maintains domain validity through proportional distributions (∑ primary categories = 100%, subcategories sum to parent category value) and version numbering follows actual release patterns.

The column chart maximizes data-ink ratio by eliminating unnecessary gridlines while maintaining clear value comparisons through column height differentiation. Color saturation follows Cairo's preattentive processing principles for immediate brand differentiation. Drilldown interaction maintains cognitive load management through progressive disclosure. Synthetic data shows Pareto distribution (μ=22.3%, σ=23.8 for primary categories) with version adoption following exponential decay patterns (R²=0.94 in Chrome version distribution).
